meanings.sent1: The children's rumpus in the playground could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The party turned into a rumpus when the music got louder.
meanings.sent3: The rumpus of the barking dogs made the neighbors laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rumpus of the storm outside matched the chaos in the house.
meanings.sent5: The rumpus of the city streets at night was both exciting and overwhelming.

meanings.definition: To make a noisy disturbance or commotion.
meanings.sent1: Please don't rumpus around while I'm trying to concentrate.
meanings.sent2: The kids rumpused in the living room, knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent3: The cat rumpused through the house, chasing after a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The wind rumpused through the trees, causing the leaves to rustle loudly.
meanings.sent5: The fans rumpused with excitement as their team scored the winning goal.
